channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights stuck, 25th July
item.description:
Seem to be stuck in red coming from halfway street towards Sidcup. Lots of cars hooting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurst Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long queues due to temporary lights, 25th July
item.description:
Could we have some signage please warning of the fact there are temporary lights? People can then take evasive action and be forewarned. Or be better prepared for a long queue. This would be much appreciated. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derwent Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Litter from bin on lampost Normanhurst rd, 25th July
item.description:
The litter from the bin has been pulled out all over the floor / pavement and needs picking up please We need a cap put on these lampost bins and no domestic waste stickers because people are putting domestic waste in them causing foxes to pull it all out .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Normanhurst Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Bins not being collected, 25th July
item.description:
This spot is for weekly collection in bin bags only. Bins were out on time, and recycling and food waste were collected. However, rubbish has not been, and now animals have been into the bags and causes littering. This has been reported before

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overhanging bush, 25th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park, London

item.title: New River water alongside path blocked, 24th July
item.description:
The New River water alongside East reservoir at Woodbury Downs is part blocked.Larger waterbirds can't access the stretch of water and it's particularly dangerous for young chicks still being born. With no maintenance, vegetation and rubbish have built up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodberry Down Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
